channel.title: BUbuisnessAndMarket
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbuisnessAndMarket, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Singapore tries to give its flagging stock market a kickstart with a link to the NASDAQ, allowing firms to easily list in both places
item.description: The bridge will appeal to companies who want to access U.S. capital, yet still tap “strong brand recognition” in Southeast Asia, says EY's Chan Yew Ki...

item.title: Protect your agentic AI before you wreck your agentic AI
item.description: On the nuances of agentic AI-driven change management during the 2026 Fortune Brainstorm Tech dinner during CES in Las Vegas.

item.title: Ford CEO Jim Farley says the White House will ‘always answer the phone,’ but needs Trump to do more to curtail China’s threat to America’s autos
item.description: President Donald Trump paid a visit to Ford’s Michigan factory this week to spotlight U.S. manufacturing.

item.title: Trump claims all the U.S. automakers are ‘doing great.’ Gretchen Whitmer says ‘this will only get worse without a serious shift’
item.description: “America stands more alone than she has in decades,” the Michigan governor said at the Detroit Auto Show.

item.title: Verizon outage spurs calls for mandatory refunds when cell service is disrupted
Chubbies cofounder Kyle Hency is back—his new startup Good Day just raised $7 million in seed funding
item.description: Good Day exclusively told Fortune they've raised $7 million in seed funding, from current investors like Ridge Ventures, FirstMark Capital, Flex Capit...

item.title: Portfolio managers are whispering about inflation worries in 2026. Here's why.
Why the S&P 500’s final push to 7,000 could be tougher than it looks
Why GLP-1 users are ditching injections and turning to other weight-loss methods
Dow ends nearly 300 points higher to lead U.S. stock market's gains Thursday
